name: Environmental Protection Agency
description: The EPA protects human health and the environment through regulation and enforcement. The agency conducts environmental assessment, research, and education on pollution control and environmental stewardship.

budget.totalBudget: $21.14 billion (including Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act funding)

painPoints.point: Massive water infrastructure funding gap - $630.1 billion needed for wastewater/stormwater over 20 years and $625 billion for drinking water systems
painPoints.source: EPA 2024 Infrastructure Needs Survey & 2023 Drinking Water Assessment

painPoints.point: PFAS contamination at federal facility Superfund sites requiring complex enforcement and remediation
painPoints.source: EPA FY2025 Budget - Superfund Enforcement Federal Facilities

painPoints.point: Public water systems must implement PFAS treatment by 2029 - technical assistance and compliance monitoring challenges
painPoints.source: Bipartisan Infrastructure Law PFAS Implementation Requirements

painPoints.point: Unclear guidance on Drinking Water SRF Emerging Contaminants funds for non-PFAS contaminants
painPoints.source: EPA OIG Report February 2025 - SRF Emerging Contaminants Guidance

painPoints.point: Climate change resilience gaps in workforce protection, facilities, critical infrastructure, and supply chains
painPoints.source: National Water Program Guidance FY2025-2026 - Climate Adaptation

painPoints.point: Limited capacity to process $10 billion in Bipartisan Infrastructure Law relief for PFAS-affected communities
painPoints.source: Bipartisan Infrastructure Law - PFAS and Emerging Contaminants Relief Program

painPoints.point: Water quality monitoring and data management system modernization needs
Procurement process vulnerabilities to climate-related supply chain disruptions

IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting environmental monitoring and regulatory IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

strategicPriorities.priority: PFAS contamination remediation and compliance - $10 billion relief program implementation
strategicPriorities.funding: $10 billion for PFAS and emerging contaminants

strategicPriorities.priority: Water infrastructure modernization - drinking water and wastewater systems upgrades
Superfund enforcement at federal facilities including PFAS contamination sites
Climate change adaptation and resilience for EPA operations and water infrastructure
Emerging contaminants monitoring, detection, and treatment technology development
strategicPriorities.source: EPA Drinking Water SRF Emerging Contaminants Program

strategicPriorities.priority: Environmental data management and water quality monitoring system upgrades
Supply chain and procurement climate resilience improvements
